(North-Western Provinces).—Educated at Eton, and Exeter College, Oxford; appointed to the Bengal civil service after open competitive examination of 1862; arrived in India, 15th Jan., 1864; from Dec., 1864, served in the N.W. Provinces as assistant magistrate and collector, and from May, 1870, to April, 1878, in the settlement department, and was appointed settlement officer, 3rd grade, Cawnpore, April, 1876; officiating director of agriculture and commerce, N.W. Provinces and Oudh, April, 1878, and again, 1880-81; joint magistrate and deputy collector, 1st grade, Nov., 1879; deputy commissioner, 2nd grade, March, 1885; magistrate and collector, and grade, Meerut, April, 1885; 1st grade, June, 1887; author of a memorandum on the 'Agriculture of Cawnpore,' 'Cawnpore Gazetteer,' 'Cawnpore Settlement Report,' and 'Report on Wheat.'

WRIGHT, FREDERICK, Police Department, Hyderabad Administration.—Arrived in India, 20th Aug., 1859; served as inspector in the Madras police from Jan., 1860; transferred to Hyderabad assigned districts, Aug., 1862, and served as assistant superintendent and district superintendent of police (1st grade, April, 1877); officiating inspector-general of police, jails, and registration, July-Oct., 1884, and again in 1885; author of 'Margpadurshuk' (a treatise on the Indian Penal Code, 1878), a police manual of laws in 1883, and a schedule to all the penal acts of the government of India, 1841 to 1883.

WRIGHT, FREDERICK C. B., Store Department, India Office.—Junior clerk, 4th July, 1867.

WRIGHT, JAMES McCALLUM, M.A., Bengal C.S. (North Western Provinces).—Educated at Fordyce School, University of Aberdeen, and University College, London; appointed to the Bengal civil service, after open competitive examination of 1883; arrived in India, and Dec., 1885; assistant magistrate and collector, N.W. Provinces.

WRIGHT, JAMES WALKER, Public Works
Department, Punjab.—Appointed to the public works department in July, 1859; served in the Punjab as assistant and executive engineer; in charge of Madhopur workshops, March, 1868; executive engineer, military works, Chakrata road, and afterwards in the Jullundur division, 1872; transferred to the Punjab provincial list, Nov., 1879; superintending engineer, and class, July, 1886; superintending engineer, 1st class, temporary, March, 1887.

WRIGHT, WILLIAM H., B.A., Educational Department, North-Western Provinces.—Appointed to the education department by secretary of state, 7th Aug., 1867, and served from 7th Dec., 1867, as professor, Benares College; professor of English literature, Muir Central College, Allahabad, July, 1872; 3rd grade of educational officers, July, 1872; principal, Bareilly College, Dec., 1873; officiating inspector of schools, June, 1875, to March, 1876; from Jan., 1877, served as professor at the Muir Central College, and officiated as principal of the Benares College, in 1878; has published a handbook of the education department, an account of the Muir Central College, and various educational works.

WYER, FREDERICK, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educated at Emmanuel College, Cambridge; appointed to the Bengal civil service after open competitive examination of 1860; arrived, 31st Dec., 1861; served in the Bengal revenue and judicial departments, and was appointed magistrate and collector, 1st grade, May, 1884; officiated as commissioner of the Burdwan division in 1883; and of the Dacca division, in 1885; retired, May, 1887.

WYER, THOMAS ROWLAND, B.A., Bengal C.S. (North-Western Provinces).—Educated at University of Glasgow, and Balliol College, Oxford; appointed to the Bengal civil service after open competitive examination of 1871; arrived in India, 20th Oct., 1873, and served in the N.W. Provinces as assistant magistrate and collector, and assistant settlement officer, and in acting appointments as joint magistrate, magistrate and collector, small cause court judge, and district and sessions judge; assistant commissioner, 2nd grade, Nov., 1884; joint magistrate, 1st grade, March, 1888.

WYLIE, HENRY, Lieut.-Colonel, C.S.I., Political Department, Government of India.—Ensign, Oct., 1861; arrived in India, 15th Nov., 1861; served with various regiments, and took part in the N.W. frontier campaign, 1863, and the Yusafai expedition (medal and clasp), the Bhutan Campaign, 1865 (clasp), the Abyssinian expedition, 1868 (medal), and the Hazara campaign, 1868 (clasp); on special duty in Beloochistan, with Major R. Sandeman, Nov., 1875, to Feb., 1877; assistant to governor-general's agent, Beloochistan, 1877; served in the Afghan campaign, 1878-80 (medal); C.S.I., Feb., 1881; assistant to the resident in Mysore, and secretary to chief commissioner, Coorg, 1882; political agent, Bhopawur, Feb., 1885; political agent, Jhalawar, April, 1885; political agent, Bhopal, March, 1887.

WYLLIE, WILLIAM HUTT CURZON, Major, C.I.E., B.S.C., Political Department, Government of India.—Ensign, 106th Foot, Oct., 1866; arrived in India, Feb., 1867; served in the Oude commission, 1870-79, as assistant commissioner and officiating cantonment and city magistrate; staff corps, 1868; acted as inspector-general of registration in 1875, and as junior secretary to government, Oude, 1876-77; from Jan., 1879, served under the foreign department, government of India, as cantonment magistrate, Nasirabad, assistant commissioner in Merwara and Ajmere, and as assistant to governor-general's agent, Beloochistan; served in Madras, 1880-81, as military secretary to the governor, and acted as private secretary; C.I.E., May, 1881; political agent, 3rd class, in political charge of ex-Gaekwar of Baroda, Mulhar Rao, 1881; assistant resident, Hyderabad, 1882; assistant commissioner, Ajmere, Nov., 1883; 1st assistant agent to governor-general, Rajputana, 1884; additional political agent, 1st class, Kotah, April, 1885; boundary settlement officer, Meywar-Marwar border; and additional political agent, 1st class, Nov., 1886.

WYNCH, LIONEL MALING, B.A., Madras C.S.—Educated at Bedford Grammar School, and Balliol College, Oxford; appointed to the Madras civil service after open competitive examination of 1882; arrived in India, 7th Dec., 1885; assistant collector and magistrate, Feb., 1886.

WYNDHAM, PERCY, Bengal C.S.—Educated at Giggleswick Grammar School and Queen's College, Oxford; appointed to the Bengal civil service after open competition of 1886.

WYNNE, SYDENHAM HENRY, B.A., Madras C.S.—Educated at the Royal Naval School, and Trinity College, Dublin; appointed to the Madras civil service after open competitive examination of 1871; arrived in India, 21st Oct., 1873, and served in Madras as assistant collector and magistrate, acting cantonment magistrate, acting sub-collector and joint magistrate, acting collector and magistrate, and acting district and sessions judge; head assistant to the collector and magistrate, South Arcot, Oct., 1884; sub-collector and joint magistrate, Dec., 1887.

YELD, HORACE PARR, Surgeon-Major, Mint Department, Bombay.—Joined the Indian medical department, 1874; was employed in the military department up to Aug., 1884, when he was appointed probationer in the assay department, Bombay mint; transferred to Calcutta mint, Sept., 1884; surgeon-major, March, 1886; deputy assay-master, Bombay mint, May, 1886, and Calcutta mint, Jan., 1888; officiating assay master, Bombay mint, April, 1888.

YOUNG, G. E., India Office Registry Department.—Appointed and class clerk, 22 May, 1888.

YOUNG, GEORGE GORDON, Colonel, B.S.C., Punjab Commission.—Arrived in India, 23rd Oct., 1856; from June, 1858, served in the Punjab as assistant commissioner, officiating small cause court judge, and assistant settlement officer; deputy commissioner, 1st grade, April, 1877; commissioner and superintendent, Delhi, Jan., 1881; and subsequently in the Jullundur division, April, 1883.; officiating and financial commissioner, Feb., 1888.

YOUNG, WILLIAM, B.A., Barrister-at-Law, Bengal C.S. (North-Western Provinces).—Educated at University College, London; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; appointed to the Bengal civil service after open competitive examination of 1856; arrived in India, 16th Dec., 1856; served in the N.W. Provinces as assistant magistrate and collector, and joint magistrate and deputy collector, and was appointed magistrate and collector, Basti, March, 1875; was subsequently posted to Mainpuri,
Moradabad, and Muzaffarnagar; civil and sessions judge, and grade, Bareilly, Oct., 1880; and afterwards at Allahabad; judicial commissioner, Oudh, Aug., 1886.

YOUNG, WILLIAM MACKWORTH, M.A., Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educated at Eton, and King's College, Cambridge; appointed to the Bengal civil service after open competitive examination of 1862; arrived in India, 12th Dec., 1863, and served in the Punjab as assistant commissioner, assistant settlement officer, officiating secretary to financial commissioner, and officiating deputy commissioner; attached on special duty to office of financial commissioner, Oct., 1872; under secretary to government, Punjab, Oct., 1873; settlement secretary to financial commissioner, March, 1875; deputy commissioner, 3rd class, Jan., 1878; officiating superintendent, Kapurthala state, Feb., 1878; secretary to government, Punjab, Jan., 1888; promoted to commissioner and superintendent, May, 1887, but officiated as secretary to government until Dec., 1887; officiating secretary to government of India, Jan.-March, 1888; commissioner, Jullundur division.

YOUNGHUSBAND, ARTHUR DELAVAL, Bombay C.S.—Educated at Rugby, and Clifton College; appointed to the Bombay civil service after open competitive examination of 1875; arrived in India, 9th Dec., 1877, and served as assistant collector and magistrate, acting junior collector and magistrate, acting talukdari settlement officer, and assistant political agent.

YOUNGHUSBAND, ROMER EDWARD, B.A. (Barrister-at-Law), Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educated at Rugby, Clifton College, and Balliol College, Oxford; appointed to the Bengal civil service after open competitive examination of 1877; arrived in India, 14th Dec., 1879, and served in the Punjab as assistant commissioner, settlement officer, officiating judicial assistant, officiating deputy commissioner, and officiating district judge; officiating under secretary to government, Punjab, March, 1885; acted as junior secretary and as senior secretary to financial commissioner; confirmed as junior secretary to financial commissioner, March, 1886; under secretary to government of Punjab, Jan., 1888.

YULE, HENRY, Colonel, C.B., Council of India.—Second lieutenant, Bengal Engineers, Dec., 1838; appointed to survey duties in the Cossya Hills, Jan., 1841; assistant superintendent of Delhi canals, 1843; officiating executive engineer, northern division, Ganges canal, June, 1846; served with the army of the Sutlej in 1846, and with the army of the Punjab in 1848-49, and was present at the action of Ramnuggar, the passage of the Chenab, and action of Sadoallapore, and the battle of Chillianwallah; deputed to report on protective measures necessary in the mountain passes of Arakan towards Burmese frontier, Jan., 1853; deputed to report on batteries for protection of Singapore harbour, August, 1853; deputy consulting engineer, railway department, Feb., 1854; deputy secretary (afterwards changed to under secretary) to government of India, public works department, Feb., 1855; deputed to proceed to Ava as secretary of the mission under Major (afterwards Sir Arthur) Phayre, July, 1855; garrison engineer, Allahabad, July, 1857, and extra superintending engineer in the N.W. Provinces, with charge of construction of defensive works at Allahabad, Benares, and Mirzapore, Aug., 1857; reappointed under secretary, public works department, Sept., 1857; officiating secretary, public works department, Nov., 1857; appointed secretary to government of India, public works department, with official rank as lieutenant-colonel, Jan., 1859; retired with honorary rank of colonel, March, 1862; from 23rd Oct., 1875, has served on the council of the Secretary of State for India, of which he is a permanent member; author of various geographical and other works; gold medallist of Royal Geographical Society, 1872, and of the Italian Geographical Society, 1871; president of the Hakluyt Society; president of the Royal Asiatic Society, 1885-86; hon. LL.D. of the University of Edinburgh, 1884; hon. fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh, and of the Scottish Society of Antiquaries; foreign or hon. member of the Geographical Societies of Paris, Berlin, Italy, &c., and of various other foreign and colonial societies.
